variable.name: ASCSOURCE
variable.comment: Ascertainment Source This file has one row for every form 121 recording outcome(s). A participant may have more than one of these forms and one form may record several different types of outcomes. Only the first occurrence of each outcome is counted, e.g. Limiting the file to rows where MI=1 will find a single row for each participant with a MI outcome. Note: strokes and carotid artery disease are in a separate file.

variable.name: ANGINA
variable.comment: Angina is adjudicated for CT and OS participants. It was not adjudicated after the WHI study closeout. Angina occurring on or after a Clinical MI is not counted.

variable.name: CABG
variable.comment: Coronary Artery Bypass Graft (CABG) CABG is adjudicated for CT and OS participants. CABG occurring on or after a Clinical MI is not counted.

variable.name: CHF
variable.comment: Congestive Heart Failure (CHF) CHF is adjudicated for CT and OS participants. It was not adjudicated after the WHI study closeout.

variable.name: MI
variable.comment: Clinical MI is adjudicated for CT and OS participants.

variable.name: CREVASC
variable.comment: Coronary revascularization procedure (CABG or PTCA) Defined as the first occurence of CABG or PTCA. Coronary Revascularization is adjudicated for CT and OS participants.

variable.name: PERIPH
variable.comment: Peripheral Arterial Disease (PAD) PAD is adjudicated for CT and OS participants.

variable.name: PTCA
variable.comment: Percutaneous Transluminal Coronary Angioplasty (PTCA) PTCA is adjudicated for CT and OS participants. PTCA occurring on or after a Clinical MI is not counted.

variable.name: ECGPATTR
variable.comment: Not collected on early versions of Form 121. Coded for MI, Coronary Death (hosp) and Coronary Revascularization. Also coded for Angina and CHF before the WHI closeout.
variable.value: Evolving Q-wave AND evolv ST-T abnormalities
Q-waves or ST-T abnormalities suggestive of MI
Other ECG pattern,ECG uncodable or normal ECG

variable.name: CARDENZY
variable.comment: Cardiac enzyme information available? Not collected on early versions of Form 121. Coded for MI, Coronary Death (hosp) and Coronary Revascularization. Also coded for Angina and CHF before the WHI closeout.

variable.name: CKMGE2XP
variable.comment: CK-MB at least 2x upper limit of normal for % or index Coded for MI, Coronary Death (hosp) and Coronary Revascularization. Also coded for Angina and CHF before the WHI closeout.

variable.name: CKMLT2XP
variable.comment: CK-MB greater than upper limit of normal but less than 2x upper limit of normal for % or index Coded for MI, Coronary Death (hosp) and Coronary Revascularization. Also coded for Angina and CHF before the WHI closeout.

variable.name: CKMNORMP
variable.comment: CK-MB within normal limits for % or index Coded for MI, Coronary Death (hosp) and Coronary Revascularization. Also coded for Angina and CHF before the WHI closeout.

variable.name: CKMGE2XU
variable.comment: CK-MB at least 2x upper limit of normal for units Coded for MI, Coronary Death (hosp) and Coronary Revascularization. Also coded for Angina and CHF before the WHI closeout.

variable.name: CKMLT2XU
variable.comment: CK-MB greater than upper limit of normal but less than 2x upper limit of normal for units Coded for MI, Coronary Death (hosp) and Coronary Revascularization. Also coded for Angina and CHF before the WHI closeout.

variable.name: CKMNORMU
variable.comment: CK-MB within normal limits for units Not collected on early versions of Form 121. Coded for MI, Coronary Death (hosp) and Coronary Revascularization. Also coded for Angina and CHF before the WHI closeout.

variable.name: CKMBPRES
variable.comment: CK-MB reported as 'present" without quantification Not collected after the WHI study closeout. Coded for MI, Coronary Death (hosp) and Coronary Revascularization. Also coded for Angina and CHF before the WHI closeout.

variable.name: CKMBWEAK
variable.comment: CK-MB reported as "weakly present" without quantification Not collected after the WHI study closeout. Coded for MI, Coronary Death (hosp) and Coronary Revascularization. Also coded for Angina and CHF before the WHI closeout.

variable.name: TCKGE2X
variable.description: Total CK >=2x upper limit of normal
variable.comment: Total CK at least 2x upper limit of normal Coded for MI, Coronary Death (hosp) and Coronary Revascularization. Also coded for Angina and CHF before the WHI closeout.

variable.name: TCKLT2X
variable.comment: Total CK greater than upper limit of normal but less than 2x upper limit of normal Coded for MI, Coronary Death (hosp) and Coronary Revascularization. Also coded for Angina and CHF before the WHI closeout.

variable.name: TCKNORM
variable.comment: Total CK within normal limits Coded for MI, Coronary Death (hosp) and Coronary Revascularization. Also coded for Angina and CHF before the WHI closeout.

variable.name: CKRESNA
variable.comment: CK result not available Coded for MI, Coronary Death (hosp) and Coronary Revascularization. Also coded for Angina and CHF before the WHI closeout.

variable.name: SERUMLDH
variable.comment: Serum lactate dehydrogenase (LDH): (Complete only if no other cardiac enzymes are available.) Not collected after the WHI study closeout. Coded for MI, Coronary Death (hosp), Coronary Revascularization, Angina and CHF.

variable.name: TROPLTES
variable.comment: Troponin lab test. Not collected on early versions of Form 121. Coded for MI, Coronary Death (hosp) and Coronary Revascularization. Also coded for Angina and CHF before the WHI closeout.

variable.name: TROPLRES
variable.comment: Results (Mark the one category that applies best.) Troponin values should be coded using the upper limit of normal (ULN) and not upper limit of indeterminate/indecisive as the reference value. Thus, if 2 cutpoints are given, choose the lower cutpoint for the upper limit of normal. Not collected on early versions of Form 121. Coded for MI, Coronary Death (hosp) and Coronary Revascularization. Also coded for Angina and CHF before the WHI closeout.

variable.name: CARDPAIN
variable.comment: Cardiac pain defined as: an acute episode of pain, discomfort or tightness in the chest, arm, throat or jaw Only coded for MIs through the WHI study closeout. In the WHI extension was coded for MI, Coronary Death (hosp) and Coronary Revascularization.

variable.name: MIDX
variable.comment: Not collected on early versions of Form 121. An MI is defined as procedure-related if it occurs within 30 days after any procedure.
variable.value: MI not result of or during procedure
MI during or resulting from procedure

variable.name: MIPROCTYP
variable.comment: Only collected during the WHI exension study.
variable.value: MI within 24 hrs after cardiac procedure

variable.name: THRMAGNT
variable.comment: Was a thrombolytic agent administered or emergent revascularization procedure (e.g., angioplasty or stent) performed? Not collected on early versions of Form 121.

variable.name: MIABORT
variable.comment: Was the myocardial infarction aborted? (Diagnosis of an aborted MI requires: symptoms and ECG evidence for acute MI at presentation; intervention [thrombolytic therapy or a procedure] followed by resolution of ECG changes; and all cardiac enzymes within normal limits.) Not collected on early versions of Form 121. Not collected after the WHI closeout. Only has values if THRMAGNT is equal to 1 or 9.

variable.name: MIFATAL
variable.comment: Was the myocardial infarction fatal? Not collected on early versions of Form 121.

variable.name: ANGADMT
variable.description: Angina MD diagnosis & treatment this admit
variable.comment: Angina based on: Physician diagnosis of angina and receiving medical treatment at discharge, for angina on this admission (e.g., nitrate, beta-blocker, or calcium-channel blocker) Not collected after the WHI study closeout.

variable.name: ANGADMTP
variable.description: Angina MD diagnosis & treament & cath hist.
variable.comment: Angina based on: Physician diagnosis of angina and receiving medical treatment for angina on this admission plus current medical record documenting a history of coronary heart disease by previous catheterization or revascularization procedure Not collected on early versions of F121. Not collected after the WHI study closeout.

variable.name: CABGOTHR
variable.description: Angina CABG or other revasc this admit
variable.comment: Angina based on: CABG surgery or other revascularization procedure on this admission. Not collected after the WHI study closeout.

variable.name: ANG70GT
variable.comment: Angina based on: 70% or greater obstruction of any coronary artery on angiography on this admission Not collected after the WHI study closeout.

variable.name: STSEGMNT
variable.comment: Angina based on: Horizontal or down-sloping ST-segment depression or abnormal ST elevation >= 1 mm on exercise or pharmacological stress testing with pain on this admission Not collected after the WHI study closeout.

variable.name: STRETEST
variable.description: Angina Stress test positive for ischemia
variable.comment: Angina based on: Scintigraphic or echocardiographic stress test positive for ischemia on this admission Not collected after the WHI study closeout.

variable.name: ANGECGST
variable.comment: Angina based on: Resting ECG shows horizontal or down-sloping ST depression or abnormal ST elevation >= 1 mm with pain that is not present on ECG without pain on this admission Not collected on early versions of F121. Not collected after the WHI study closeout.

variable.name: CHFDXTX
variable.description: CHF MD diagnosis & treatment this admit
variable.comment: CHF based on: Congestive failure diagnosed by physician and receiving medical treatment for CHF on this admission (e.g., diuretic, digitalis, vasodilator and/or angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor) Not collected after the WHI study closeout.

variable.name: CHFDXTXI
variable.comment: CHF based on: Congestive failure diagnosed by physician and receiving medical treatment on this admission plus current medical record documents a history of an imaging procedure showing impaired systolic or diastolic LV function Not collected on early versions of Form 121. Not collected after the WHI study closeout.

variable.name: CHFPULM
variable.description: CHF Pulmonary edema chest X-ray this admit
variable.comment: CHF based on: Pulmonary edema\congestion by chest X-ray on this admission Not collected after the WHI study closeout.

variable.name: CHFDIVNT
variable.description: CHF Dilated ventricle or poor left function
variable.comment: CHF based on: On this admission, dilated ventricle or poor left (or right-side) ventricular function (e.g., wall motion abnormalities) by echocardiography; radionuclide ventriculogram (RVG)/multigated acquisition (MUGA), or other contrast ventriculography, or evidence of left ventricular diastolic dysfunction Not collected after the WHI study closeout.

variable.name: CHFFATAL
variable.comment: Was the congestive heart failure fatal? Not collected after the WHI study closeout.

variable.name: CORR2MI
variable.comment: Second myocardial infarction (MI) (i.e., second MI not already reported in Question 4) occurring as a result of or during the revascularization procedure. Not collected on early versions of Form 121. Not collected after the WHI study closeout. Only collected for coronary revascularizations (CABG/PTCA).

variable.name: PADDX
variable.comment: Diagnosis: (Mark the one category that applies best.) Value 4 was not available on early versions of form 121.
variable.value: Atherosclerosis of arteries of the lower extremities
Arterial embolism and/or thrombosis of the lower extremities

variable.name: PADPLAQ
variable.comment: PAD based on: Ultrasonographically- or angiographically-demonstrated obstruction, or ulcerated plaque (>= 50% of the diameter or >= 75% of the cross-sectional area) demonstrated on ultrasound or angiogram of the iliac arteries or below

variable.name: PADABDOP
variable.comment: PAD based on: Absence of pulse by doppler in any major vessel of lower extremities

variable.name: PADEXER
variable.comment: PAD based on: Exercise test that is positive for lower extremity claudication

variable.name: PADSURG
variable.comment: PAD based on: Surgery, angioplasty, or thrombolysis for peripheral arterial disease

variable.name: PADAMP
variable.description: PAD Amputation of one or more toes
variable.comment: PAD based on: Amputation of one or more toes or part of the lower extremity because of ischemia or gangrene

variable.name: PADLEG
variable.comment: PAD based on: Exertional leg pain relieved by rest and at least one of the following: (1) claudication diagnosed by physician, or (2) ankle-arm systolic blood pressure ratio <= 0.8

variable.name: PADULANR
variable.comment: PAD based on: Ultrasonographically- or angiographically-demonstrated abdominal aortic aneurysm Not collected on early versions of Form 121.

variable.name: PADSRANR
variable.comment: PAD based on: Surgical or vascular procedure for abdominal aortic aneurysm Not collected on early versions of Form 121.
